en: The human soul longs for something noble.
zh: 人类的灵魂渴望高尚的东西。

en: Hope springs eternal in the human breast.
zh: 希望在人的心中永不磨灭。

en: A man's worth lies not so much in what he has as in what he is.
zh: 一个人的价值主要在于他的为人，而不是他拥有什么。

en: A man's worth lies in what he is rather than what he has.
zh: 一个人的价值在于他的内在，而不是他的财富。

en: A man's worth lies in what he is.
zh: 一个人的价值在于他是一个什么样的人。

en: A man's worth lies not in what he has but in what he is.
zh: 一个人的价值不在于他拥有什么，而在于他是什么样的人。

en: A man's worth depends on what he is, and not what he has.
zh: 一个人的价值取决于他的为人，而不是他的身外之物。

en: Man has the ability to talk.
zh: 人类有说话的能力。

en: Man has reason, animals do not.
zh: 人有理性，而动物没有。

en: Water is as precious as air to man.
zh: 对人来说，水和空气一样珍贵。

en: Man is a more dangerous foe to man than the elements of nature or animals in the wild.
zh: 对人类来说，同类比自然灾害或野生动物更危险。

en: Human nature revolts against such a crime.
zh: 人性是没法容忍这种罪行的。

en: It is language that distinguishes man from beasts.
zh: 语言是把人和禽兽区别开来的东西。

en: This is where human beings and animals greatly differ.
zh: 这就是人和动物最大的不同点。

en: Every person has a psychological need to feel that what he does is of some importance.
zh: 每个人在心理上都需要觉得，自己做的事是有意义的。

en: Man alone has the ability to reason.
zh: 只有人类才有理性思考的能力。

en: Human beings alone take a very long time to bring up their little ones.
zh: 只有人类需要花这么长时间来抚养后代。

en: Only human beings are capable of speech.
zh: 只有人类才会说话。

en: Just when the first human beings will reach Mars remains to be seen.
zh: 第一批人类到底什么时候能登上火星，还有待观察。

en: It is no longer a dream for man to live on the moon.
zh: 人类住在月球上已经不再是梦想了。

en: It matters not how a man dies, but how he lives.
zh: 一个人怎么死的并不重要，重要的是他怎么活的。

en: The time may come when people will have used up all the oil.
zh: 没准哪天人类就把石油全用光了。

en: It's possible, though rare, for humans to catch diseases from animals.
zh: 人类从动物身上感染疾病虽然少见，但也是可能的。

en: Men, dogs, fish, and birds are all animals.
zh: 人、狗、鱼和鸟都是动物。

en: What one is is more important than what one has.
zh: 一个人的为人比他拥有的东西更重要。

en: You have to blast your way out.
zh: 你得硬闯出一条路来。

en: Visiting people is nicer than being visited.
zh: 去串门比等别人来串门要有意思。

en: Don't judge a man by his clothes.
zh: 别凭穿衣打扮看人。

en: Don't make a fool of me.
zh: 别耍我。

en: The secret of influencing people lies not so much in being a good talker as in being a good listener.
zh: 想要影响别人，与其能说会道，不如做一个好的倾听者。

en: In order to know a man, you have only to travel with him for a week.
zh: 想了解一个人，跟他一起旅行一个礼拜就行了。

en: You should not keep people waiting.
zh: 不该让人家久等。

en: It is wrong of you to discriminate against people because of their race.
zh: 因为种族而歧视别人是不对的。

en: It is rude to laugh at others.
zh: 嘲笑别人是很没礼貌的。

en: He who helps others, in turn shall be helped by them.
zh: 帮助别人的人，也会得到别人的帮助。

en: It is not right to put a man to death for punishment.
zh: 处死一个人作为惩罚是不对的。

en: Don't point at others.
zh: 别用手指着别人。

en: It is bad manners to point at people.
zh: 用手指着别人是很没礼貌的。

en: It is rude to point at people.
zh: 指着别人很不礼貌。

en: It's rude to point at anyone.
zh: 指着任何人都是不礼貌的。

en: We sometimes judge others based on their actions.
zh: 有时候我们会根据一个人的行为来判断他。

en: Could you page someone for me?
zh: 能帮我广播找个人吗？

en: You shouldn't judge a man by his appearance.
zh: 你不该以貌取人。

en: You shouldn't judge a person by his appearance.
zh: 不应该看长相来评判一个人。

en: Never trust a stranger.
zh: 永远别相信陌生人。

en: Don't judge people by their appearance.
zh: 别以貌取人。

en: Don't judge people by appearance.
zh: 别光看长相。

en: Distrust of people, not to mention hate, is the root of human suffering.
zh: 对人的不信任，更不用说仇恨，是人类痛苦的根源。

en: You shouldn't judge a person by his looks.
zh: 你不应该只看一个人的长相。

en: You should not judge a person by his appearance alone.
zh: 不应该只凭外表判断一个人。

en: When we deal with people, it would be wise to try to separate the sheep from the goats without letting them know it.
zh: 跟人打交道时，最好能在不被察觉的情况下分辨出好人和坏人。

en: We'd better send for help.
zh: 我们最好找人帮忙。

en: Don't judge a man by what he has.
zh: 别看一个人有多少钱来衡量他。

en: You should not judge people by their appearance.
zh: 不该凭外表看人。

en: Mary scared Tom out of his wits.
zh: 玛丽把汤姆吓坏了。

en: Let's refrain from stabbing people with knives.
zh: 咱们还是别拿刀捅人了。

en: It's impolite to stare at people.
zh: 盯着别人看是不礼貌的。

en: Don't make fun of people.
zh: 别取笑人家。

en: Don't kid me!
zh: 别逗我了！

en: Don't make fun of other people.
zh: 别拿别人开玩笑。

en: It is not good to laugh at others.
zh: 嘲笑别人不好。

en: The people have made their preparations for the trip.
zh: 大家已经为旅行做好了准备。

en: People thought him to be a great scholar.
zh: 大家都觉得他是个了不起的学者。

en: A time will soon come when people can enjoy space travel.
zh: 人们可以享受太空旅行的时代很快就要到了。

en: People react to the frustration in much the same way.
zh: 面对挫折，人们的反应都差不多。

en: You can know a man by his friends.
zh: 看一个人的朋友就能知道他是什么样的人。

en: A man is known by his friends.
zh: 观其友知其人。

en: One shouldn't betray one's friends.
zh: 不该背叛朋友。

en: Man likes bright sunshine.
zh: 人类喜欢灿烂的阳光。

en: Man is the measure of all things.
zh: 人是万物的尺度。

en: People usually go after fame.
zh: 人们通常追逐名利。

en: You will be known by the company you keep.
zh: 看看你交的朋友，就知道你是什么样的人。

en: People can turn to the law if they want to correct an injustice.
zh: 想要伸张正义，人们可以寻求法律帮助。

en: Man modifies to his needs what nature produces.
zh: 人类会根据自己的需要改造自然产物。

en: A man is not always what he seems.
zh: 一个人并不总是他看起来的那样。

en: One is more prone to make mistakes when one is tired.
zh: 人在累的时候更容易犯错。

en: The older we grow, the more forgetful we become.
zh: 年纪越大，就越容易忘事。

en: As one grows older, one becomes more silent.
zh: 随着年龄增长，人会变得越来越沉默。

en: The older one grows, the weaker one's memory becomes.
zh: 人年纪越大，记性就越差。

en: A man will succeed to the same extent as he perseveres.
zh: 一个人能不能成功，全看他能不能坚持。

en: One can't do lots of things at the same time.
zh: 一个人没法同时做好多件事。

en: One cannot do lots of things at the same time.
zh: 人没法同时干好几样活。

en: People can't do a lot of things at the same time.
zh: 大家都不能同时做很多事情。

en: A man must work.
zh: 人总得干活。

en: One should be considerate about things and considerate of people.
zh: 做事要周到，待人要体谅。

en: A man can receive only what is given to him from heaven.
zh: 一个人能得到什么，全看老天爷给不给。

en: The more a man knows, the more he discovers his ignorance.
zh: 人知道得越多，就越觉得自己无知。

en: A person is either male or female.
zh: 一个人要么是男的，要么是女的。

en: All are equal.
zh: 人人平等。

en: Everyone should periodically receive a physical examination.
zh: 大家都该定期去体检。

en: Every sane man is accountable to his conscience for his behavior.
zh: 每一个神智正常的人都得对自己的良心负责。

en: Not everybody can be an artist.
zh: 不是谁都能当艺术家的。

en: Not everybody wants to be an artist.
zh: 不是每个人都想当艺术家。

en: All men have some natural talent, but the question is whether they can use it or not.
zh: 每个人都有点天赋，关键看你会不会用。

en: Every man has his own strong points.
zh: 每个人都有自己的长处。

en: One should wash oneself.
zh: 人得把自己洗干净。

en: People should wash themselves.
zh: 人应该勤洗澡。

en: People should wash their bodies.
zh: 人得把身上洗干净。

en: It is generally accepted that a person cannot be successful in life without a lot of hard work.
zh: 大家公认，如果不努力，这辈子都不会成功。

en: A man is more or less what he looks like.
zh: 一个人的长相多多少少能反映出他的性格。

en: People once held that the world was flat.
zh: 以前人们觉得地球是平的。

en: As soon as man is born he begins to die.
zh: 人一出生，其实就开始走向死亡了。

en: Are people born intelligent or stupid, or is intelligence the result of how you live?
zh: 人的聪明才智是天生的，还是后天养成的？

en: Is it valid to say that all men are created equal?
zh: 说“人人生而平等”这话靠谱吗？

en: From the moment of his birth, man cannot get along without depending on others.
zh: 人从一出生开始，就没法脱离别人独自生活。

en: Man eats to live, he does not live to eat.
zh: 人是为了活着才吃饭，不是为了吃饭才活着。

en: A man must be honest.
zh: 做人一定要诚实。

en: One must always keep one's promise.
zh: 说话得算数。

en: It's necessary for us to sleep well.
zh: 咱们得好好睡一觉。

en: One must love one's neighbor.
zh: 人得爱邻居。

en: One should keep one's promise.
zh: 做人要守信用。

en: We must be careful of our health.
zh: 咱们得注意身体。

en: A man is responsible for his deeds.
zh: 一个人得为自己的行为负责。

en: One learns from one's own mistakes.
zh: 人都是从错误中吸取教训的。

en: One should do one's duties.
zh: 每个人都应该尽到自己的责任。

en: One must do one's duty.
zh: 必须尽职尽责。

en: One ought to be true to oneself.
zh: 人得对自己诚实。

en: One is apt to think oneself faultless. State the facts as they are.
zh: 人总觉得自己没错，但说话做事得实事求是。

en: You don't know when you're alive.
zh: 你真是身在福中不知福。

en: People are sometimes tempted to eat more than they should.
zh: 人有时候就是忍不住想多吃点。

en: The more people have, the more they want.
zh: 拥有的越多，想要的就越多。

en: The more we have, the more we want.
zh: 咱们得到的越多，想要的就越多。

en: Man lives in communities such as cities and countries.
zh: 人生活在城市或国家这样的社群里。

en: One should do one's best.
zh: 凡事都要尽力而为。

en: Man fears disasters such as floods and fires.
zh: 人总怕洪水、火灾这种灾难。

en: It may be said that a man is known by the company he keeps.
zh: 看一个人的朋友，就能看出他是个什么样的人。

en: People love to inspect each other's houses.
zh: 大家都爱互相参观房子。

en: People love to check out each other's houses.
zh: 大家都喜欢看别人家的房子。

en: We express our thoughts by means of words.
zh: 我们用语言来表达想法。

en: Men are not always what they seem to be.
zh: 人不能只看表面。

en: A man cannot be judged by his appearance.
zh: 评价一个人不能光看外表。

en: One should take care of oneself.
zh: 一个人得照顾好自己。

en: You should take care of yourself.
zh: 你得照顾好你自己。

en: People learn from experience.
zh: 人都是从经验中学习的。

en: Men can not exist without air.
zh: 没空气人就活不了。

en: Accordingly as people become rich, they are apt to be stingy.
zh: 人一变有钱，往往就变抠门了。

en: A person views things differently according to whether they are rich or poor.
zh: 穷人和富人看问题的角度是不一样的。

en: People look at things differently depending on whether they are rich or poor.
zh: 有钱还是没钱，看事情的角度完全不同。

en: One tends to shout when excited.
zh: 人一兴奋就爱大喊大叫。

en: People tend to raise their voices when they get excited.
zh: 人一激动说话声音就会变大。

en: People have the tendency to speak more loudly when they get excited.
zh: 人在激动的时候往往说话声音会变大。

en: We learn by teaching.
zh: 我们在教别人的时候也能学到东西。

en: One should do one's duty.
zh: 每个人都该尽到自己的责任。

en: We are born crying, spend our lives complaining, and die disappointed.
zh: 我们哭着出生，在抱怨中度过一生，最后带着失望死去。

en: One must observe the rules.
zh: 人得守规矩。

en: People have to obey the rules.
zh: 大家都得遵守规则。

en: All men must die.
zh: 人总归都是要死的。

en: Everyone ought to be a master of his own destiny.
zh: 每个人都该掌握自己的命运。

en: People should be the masters of their own destinies.
zh: 人们应当主宰自己的命运。

en: Everyone ought to be the master of his own destiny.
zh: 每个人都应该是自己命运的主人。

en: Every man cannot be happy.
zh: 并不是每个人都能过得幸福。

en: Everybody wants to be happy.
zh: 谁都想过得开心点。

en: I don't suppose you ever really get over the death of a child.
zh: 我觉得孩子夭折这种痛，人一辈子都很难真正走出来。

en: One should not lament over past mistakes too long.
zh: 人不该老惦记着以前犯的错。

en: One must do one's best in everything.
zh: 凡事都得尽力而为。

en: Man is above all things the talking animal.
zh: 说到底，人就是会说话的动物。

en: People are given a lot of pleasure by music.
zh: 音乐给人们带来了很多快乐。

en: People can't live forever.
zh: 人是不可能长生不老的。

en: Man cannot live forever.
zh: 人没法永远活下去。

en: One can't quarrel with destiny.
zh: 人没法跟命争。

en: People as a whole don't do things like that.
zh: 大家一般都不会干那种事。

en: Man is a conscious being.
zh: 人是有意识的生物。

en: People often take me for my brother.
zh: 别人老把我认成我哥。

en: Men will not look at things as they really are, but as they wish them to be.
zh: 人们往往不是看事物的真相，而是看他们想看到的样子。

en: The more one has, the more one wants.
zh: 人越有就越想要。

en: Everyone has a right to live.
zh: 每个人都有生存的权利。

en: All men are fallible.
zh: 是人都会犯错。

en: Everyone is a moon, and has a dark side which he never shows to anybody.
zh: 每个人都像月亮，都有不为人知的阴暗面。

en: Different people have different ideas.
zh: 每个人都有不同的想法。

en: One can't learn to do anything without making mistakes.
zh: 不犯错是什么也学不会的。

en: One is judged by one's speech first of all.
zh: 评价一个人首先要看他怎么说话。

en: When we are praised, we gain confidence.
zh: 被表扬的时候，我们会变得更有信心。

en: One must do one's best.
zh: 一个人必须得尽力。

en: People should do their best.
zh: 大家都应当尽力而为。

en: No one can live by and for himself.
zh: 谁也没法只为自己活着。

en: It says in the Bible, "Man shall not live on bread alone."
zh: 圣经上说：“人活着不单是靠食物。”

en: One will be judged by one's appearance first of all.
zh: 评价一个人首先看的是外表。

en: No matter how old one may be, one can learn.
zh: 活到老，学到老。

en: No matter how rich a man may be, he ought not to be idle.
zh: 一个人再有钱，也不该无所事事。

en: No matter how rich people are, they always want more.
zh: 再有钱的人也总是想要更多。

en: People often don't notice their own faults.
zh: 人往往察觉不到自己的缺点。

en: People used to associate demonstrations with students.
zh: 以前人们一提到游行就会想到学生。

en: People carried their own weight then.
zh: 那时候大家都尽自己的本分。

en: We are all liable to make mistakes.
zh: 我们每个人都会犯错。

en: We're all liable to make mistakes.
zh: 是人都会犯错。

en: Every man is master in his own house.
zh: 每个人在自己家里都是老大。

en: I think everyone looks back on their childhood with some regret.
zh: 我觉得每个人回想起童年都会有些遗憾。

en: No matter how rich a person is, he shouldn't be idle.
zh: 一个人再怎么有钱，也不该闲着。

en: Each person has a duty to do.
zh: 每个人都有该尽的责任。

en: Each has his own duty to do.
zh: 每个人都有自己的责任。

en: Although each person follows a different path, our destinations are the same.
zh: 虽然每个人走的路不同，但目的地是一样的。

en: So many men, so many minds.
zh: 每个人都有自己的想法。

en: One should love one's own mother.
zh: 人应该爱自己的母亲。

en: All shall die.
zh: 人终究都会死。

en: Everyone dies.
zh: 每个人都会死。

en: Men can only be corrected by showing them what they are.
zh: 只有让人看清自己，才能让他们改正。

en: We know that all men are mortal.
zh: 我们都知道人终有一死。

en: One is often judged by the company one keeps.
zh: 看一个人交什么样的朋友，就能看出他是怎样的人。

en: People usually become famous at the cost of their privacy.
zh: 成名的代价通常是失去隐私。

en: People are apt to make excuses.
zh: 人总喜欢找借口。

en: Don't throw a wet blanket over our conversation.
zh: 别在聊天的时候泼冷水。

en: A man should not be judged by his station in life.
zh: 不该以社会地位来评价一个人。

en: It is rude to interrupt others.
zh: 打断别人说话是很不礼貌的。

en: You should not expect the help of others.
zh: 你不该指望别人的帮助。

en: It's good to put yourself in someone else's place now and then.
zh: 偶尔换位思考一下挺好的。

en: All you ever do is nitpick. I wish you could say something more constructive.
zh: 你就知道挑刺，能不能说点有建设性的话？

en: Stop sticking your nose into other people's business.
zh: 别老插手别人的闲事。

en: There is no more dangerous experiment than that of undertaking to be one thing before a man's face and another behind his back.
zh: 当面一套背后一套最危险了。

en: They are talking loudly when they know they are disturbing others.
zh: 他们明知道会吵到别人，还大声说话。

en: It is his constant boast that he has a good memory for names.
zh: 他总吹嘘自己记人名特别准。

en: I don't understand how in the world they can take your stuff for safekeeping, but then the post office guy has the nerve to tell you "Sorry, we lost it" and expect that to be the end of it.
zh: 我真不明白，东西交给他们保管，邮局的人居然有脸说“不好意思弄丢了”就完事了。

en: Man's skin is very sensitive to temperature changes.
zh: 人的皮肤对温度变化非常敏感。

en: The burden is light on the shoulder.
zh: 肩上的担子并不重。

en: A man's worth lies in what he is, not in what he has.
zh: 人的价值在于他的品德，而不在于他拥有的东西。

en: Men get their growth before they are thirty.
zh: 人在三十岁之前就定型了。

en: One's lifestyle is largely determined by money.
zh: 一个人的生活方式很大程度上是由金钱决定的。

en: In order to know a man, you have only to travel with him a week.
zh: 想了解一个人，只要跟他旅行一个星期就够了。

en: In order to get to know a person, one merely needs to travel with them for a week.
zh: 只要一起旅行一周，你就能了解一个人的为人。

en: The life of a person is a transient thing.
zh: 人的生命是短暂的。

en: Recognize and respect the personality of a person.
zh: 要认可并尊重一个人的个性。

en: By other's faults wise men correct their own.
zh: 聪明人会以他人的过错为鉴，改正自己的错误。

en: A man's heart is about as large as his fist.
zh: 人的心脏大概和自己的拳头一样大。

en: Do not always ride on someone's coat-tail.
zh: 别老想沾别人的光。

en: Don't follow anybody blindly.
zh: 别盲目跟从任何人。

en: Everybody loves a winner.
zh: 大家都喜欢成功的人。

en: One's success in life has little to do with one's inborn gift.
zh: 一个人的成功和天分关系不大。

en: When people meet, first impressions determine more than 50 percent of whatever happens next.
zh: 两人见面时，第一印象就决定了后续发展的一大半。

en: Don't meddle in other people's affairs.
zh: 别管别人的闲事。

en: As a man lives, so shall he die.
zh: 人是怎么活的，就会怎么死。

en: So the Son of Man must be lifted up.
zh: 人子也必须这样被举起来。

en: One's view is determined by his education, sex, class and age.
zh: 一个人的观点是由他的教育背景、性别、阶层和年龄决定的。

en: A man's happiness depends on what he is rather than on what he has.
zh: 一个人的幸福取决于他是个什么样的人，而不是他拥有什么。

en: A man's happiness doesn't depend on what he has, but on what he is.
zh: 一个人的幸福不在于他拥有什么，而在于他是个什么样的人。

en: I wouldn't like to cash in on other people's misfortunes.
zh: 我不想趁人之危去牟利。

en: Don't depend on others' kindness.
zh: 别指望别人的仁慈。

en: We cannot control the tongues of others.
zh: 我们管不住别人的嘴。

en: Every man has his humor.
zh: 每个人都有自己的脾气。

en: A person's face tells a great deal about his character.
zh: 一个人的长相能看出他的性格。

en: Don't say such things that hurt others' feelings.
zh: 别说这种伤人的话。

en: You must try to avoid hurting people's feelings.
zh: 你得尽量避免伤害别人的感情。

en: A man's worth should be judged by his character rather than by his social position.
zh: 衡量一个人的价值应该看他的品质，而不是社会地位。

en: A man's worth lies in what he is rather than in what he has.
zh: 一个人的价值在于他是个什么样的人，而不是他拥有什么。

en: A man's worth does not lie in what he has, but in what he is.
zh: 一个人的价值不在于他拥有什么，而在于他是个什么样的人。

en: A man's worth has nothing to do with his appearance.
zh: 一个人的价值跟他的长相没关系。

en: It will be a nine-day's wonder.
zh: 这事儿也就新鲜几天。

en: You can't trust rumors.
zh: 传闻不可信。

en: It is not right to criticize people behind their backs.
zh: 在背后议论别人是不对的。

en: You gain nothing by speaking ill of others.
zh: 说别人坏话对你没任何好处。

en: Don't speak ill of others.
zh: 别说别人坏话。

en: Learn wisdom from the faults of others.
zh: 从别人的错误中吸取教训。

en: Now that people can steal passwords, illegal impersonation is becoming a serious problem.
zh: 既然密码能被盗，冒用他人身份就成了一个严重的问题。

en: It is polite to open doors for people.
zh: 给别人开门是一种礼貌。

en: Tastes differ.
zh: 萝卜青菜，各有所爱。

en: It isn't polite to stare at people.
zh: 盯着人看是不礼貌的。

en: You'd better mind your own business.
zh: 你最好少管闲事。

en: Why don't you mind your own business? What do you gain by sticking your nose into other people's affairs?
zh: 你干嘛不少管闲事？瞎掺和别人的事对你有什么好处？

en: Don't speak ill of others while they are away.
zh: 别在背后说人坏话。

en: You must not cast a spell upon someone inside the school.
zh: 你绝不能在学校里对人施咒。

en: No one feels displeased when he is praised.
zh: 没人在被夸奖的时候会不高兴。

en: My husband got the hots for a Canadian and is threatening me with divorce.
zh: 我老公迷上了一个加拿大人，正威胁要跟我离婚。

en: Don't let anyone take advantage of you.
zh: 别让人占了你便宜。

en: Practice what you preach.
zh: 说到就要做到。

en: When meeting a person for the first time, be sure to pay attention to the distance placed between yourself and your partner.
zh: 第一次见面时，一定要注意你和对方之间的距离。

en: The first time you meet people, you should be careful about how near you stand to them.
zh: 第一次见人的时候，要注意站得别太近。

en: When you meet someone for the first time, be careful about how close you stand to that person.
zh: 当你第一次见某人时，要注意保持适当的距离。

en: To persuade somebody that your recommendation is reasonable and wise, you have to give reasons and quote known examples and authorities.
zh: 要想说服别人你的建议是合理的，你得列出理由，并引用已知的例子和权威。

en: I'm not good at meeting people.
zh: 我不太擅长社交。

en: Every man in his way.
zh: 每个人都有自己的方式。

en: Different strokes for different folks.
zh: 人各有所好。

en: Some people gain weight when they stop smoking.
zh: 有些人戒烟后会变胖。

en: Opinions vary from person to person.
zh: 每个人的看法都不一样。

en: Blessed are those who give without remembering and take without forgetting.
zh: 施恩而不记，受恩而不忘的人是幸福的。

en: He that cannot ask cannot live.
zh: 不懂提问的人没法生存。

en: Every man has his weak side.
zh: 每个人都有软弱的一面。

en: We have two ears.
zh: 我们有两只耳朵。

en: Speak kindly to others.
zh: 跟人说话客气点。

en: Each man has his own field of work.
zh: 每个人都有自己的工作领域。

en: Each person has various reasons for going on a trip abroad.
zh: 每个人出国旅游的原因都各不相同。

en: People differ in habits.
zh: 每个人的生活习惯都不一样。

en: People have worldly passions which lead them into delusions and sufferings.
zh: 人都有七情六欲，这会让人陷入迷惘和痛苦。

en: For he knew what was in a man.
zh: 因为他看透了人心。

en: Could you bear anyone to treat you like that?
zh: 别人那样对你，你能受得了吗？

en: If someone irritates you, it is best not to react immediately.
zh: 要是有人惹了你，最好别马上发火。

en: I can't talk with people.
zh: 我不太会跟人打交道。

en: When meeting a person for the first time, keep the conversation light.
zh: 第一次见面的时候，聊点轻松的话题就好。

en: Be punctual for appointments, otherwise you'll lose face.
zh: 约会得准时，不然挺丢面子的。

en: People and robots can cooperate with each other in making life easier.
zh: 人和机器人可以相互配合，让生活更方便。

en: Not a soul was to be seen.
zh: 连个人影儿也看不见。

en: It is impolite to elbow one's way through the crowd.
zh: 在人群里乱挤是很没礼貌的。

en: That's only because you don't have to do it.
zh: 那只是因为不用你亲自动手。

en: Don't think it has nothing to do with you.
zh: 别以为这事儿跟你没关系。

en: Do not interrupt when another is speaking.
zh: 别人说话的时候别插嘴。

en: You should hold your tongue while someone else is talking.
zh: 别人说话的时候，你得管住自己的嘴。

en: You ought to keep quiet when people are talking.
zh: 别人说话的时候，你应该保持安静。

en: Don't cut in while others are talking.
zh: 别人说话的时候别随便打断。

en: Don't interrupt people when they're talking.
zh: 别人说话的时候别打扰人家。

en: You often hear people compare life to voyage, don't you?
zh: 你经常听人把人生比作航行，对吧？

en: I don't care a damn what people think of me.
zh: 我一点儿也不在乎别人怎么看我。

en: At one time it was thought impracticable for man to fly.
zh: 以前人们觉得人类想飞上天是不可能的。

en: You should not respect a man because he is rich.
zh: 你不该仅仅因为一个人有钱就尊重他。

en: The most valuable skill one can acquire is the ability to think for oneself.
zh: 一个人能学到的最宝贵的技能就是独立思考的能力。

en: I don't care what people say.
zh: 我不在乎别人说什么。

en: I do not mind what people say.
zh: 我不介意别人怎么说。

en: I don't mind what people say.
zh: 别人怎么说我都不在乎。

en: Americans are all ears when people say something.
zh: 当别人说话时，美国人总是听得特别认真。

en: Do as you would be done by.
zh: 你想别人怎么对待你，你就怎么对待别人。

en: I don't think I would ever shop until I had to go into debt because of it.
zh: 我觉得我不会买东西买到欠债的地步。

en: I'll stand by you no matter what others may say.
zh: 不管别人说什么，我都会支持你。

en: A shiver ran down my spine.
zh: 我感到脊背一阵发凉。

en: Wires are used to convey electricity.
zh: 电线是用来输电的。

en: Wires transmit electricity.
zh: 电线传输电流。

en: The hand on its axis turns at 10 revolutions per hour.
zh: 指针绕着轴每小时转十圈。

en: You might hear a pin drop.
zh: 掉根针的声音都能听得见。

en: It's quiet enough to hear a pin drop.
zh: 安静得连掉根针的声音都能听见。

en: I don't like sewing because I can't thread the needle.
zh: 我不喜欢缝补，因为我穿不上针。

en: Don't you have a needle and some thread?
zh: 你没有针线吗？

en: I pricked my thumb with a needle.
zh: 我的大拇指被针扎了一下。

en: I asked my teacher for advice on my future course.
zh: 我向老师咨询了关于未来规划的建议。

en: I am in a tight place.
zh: 我现在的处境挺难办的。

en: Shinko is full of fight.
zh: 真子非常有斗志。

en: Shinko is kindness itself.
zh: 真子这人特别善良。

en: Shinko disputed with him about it.
zh: 真子为了这事儿跟他争论了一番。

en: Shinko's brother is eight.
zh: 真子的弟弟八岁了。

en: Never get off the train while it is going.
zh: 火车开着的时候千万别下车。

en: Progress is monitored daily and stored in a database.
zh: 进度每天都有监控，并且记录在数据库里。

en: The theory of evolution is beyond the reach of my imagination.
zh: 进化论超出了我的想象。

en: The theory of evolution surpasses the scope of my imagination.
zh: 进化论完全超出了我的想象范围。

en: Progress is a comfortable disease.
zh: 进步是一种让人安逸的病。

en: You will learn your lessons only in so far as you are willing to keep studying them.
zh: 只有当你愿意坚持学下去时，你才能真正学到东西。

en: Willingness to take responsibility is a sign of maturity.
zh: 敢于承担责任是成熟的表现。

en: One who is not willing to learn is not worth teaching.
zh: 一个不想学的人不值得教。

en: I was uncertain whether to advance or to retreat.
zh: 我当时犹豫不决，不知道该进还是该退。

en: It's patience that counts.
zh: 关键是要有耐心。

en: You must persevere before you can succeed.
zh: 你必须坚持下去才能成功。

en: I want something dry.
zh: 我想要点干的东西。

en: You shouldn't eat anything spicy.
zh: 你不该吃辣的。

en: Some people love hot curry, but it's not Jeff's cup of tea.
zh: 有些人很喜欢辣咖喱，但杰夫不喜欢这口。

en: May I see two pieces of identification?
zh: 我可以看一下您的两件身份证件吗？

en: Any student with an I.D. card has access to the library.
zh: 只要有学生证，任何学生都能进图书馆。

en: Do you have any ID?
zh: 你带身份证了吗？

en: Remember your station in life.
zh: 认清你自己的身份。

en: Rank boys according to their height.
zh: 按身高给男生排个队。

en: I really enjoy helping disabled people.
zh: 我真的很喜欢帮助残疾人。

en: One must take good care of oneself.
zh: 一个人必须照顾好自己。

en: The body must be developed along with the mind.
zh: 身体和心智必须同步发展。

en: Big men are not necessarily strong men.
zh: 块头大的人不一定强壮。

en: Just as the body needs exercise, so the mind needs stimulation to stay healthy.
zh: 就像身体需要锻炼一样，大脑也需要刺激来保持健康。

en: Gestural language had, however, serious limitations, since it could not be used in the dark or at distance.
zh: 不过，手势语言有很大的局限性，因为它在黑暗中或远处没法用。

en: Gesture is another way of communication.
zh: 手势是另一种沟通方式。

en: It's bitter cold.
zh: 天冷得刺骨。

en: You don't have to play outside in the biting wind.
zh: 你没必要在这么大的寒风里在外面玩。

en: Risk all and gain all.
zh: 放手一搏，赢得一切。

en: I hope to earn a respectable income by the time I settle down.
zh: 我希望在安顿下来的时候能有一份体面的收入。

en: Cut one's coat according to one's cloth.
zh: 看菜吃饭，量体裁衣。

en: The honor you are giving me is more than I deserve.
zh: 您给我的这份荣誉我受之有愧。

en: Make yourself presentable.
zh: 把你自己收拾得体面点。

en: Clothes make the man.
zh: 人靠衣装，马靠鞍。

en: She is regardless of her appearance.
zh: 她一点也不在乎自己的形象。

en: Don't despise a man just because he is poorly dressed.
zh: 不要因为一个人穿得破烂就瞧不起他。

en: Judging from her appearance, I think that she's rich.
zh: 从她的打扮来看，我觉得她很有钱。

en: Can I make an appointment to have a medical examination?
zh: 我能预约做个体检吗？

en: You must leave diagnosis to your doctor.
zh: 诊断的事儿你得听医生的。

en: Can I use my travelers' checks to pay the fee?
zh: 我能用旅行支票付钱吗？

en: Can I use my credit card?
zh: 我能刷信用卡吗？

en: Lie on your back on the examination table.
zh: 请平躺在检查台上。

en: Lie on your stomach on the examination table.
zh: 请趴在检查台上。

en: You can get up from the examination table now.
zh: 你现在可以从检查台上起来了。

en: From what time to what time is your office open?
zh: 你们的办公时间是从几点到几点？

en: I forgot to bring my I.D. card.
zh: 我忘了带身份证了。

en: A morning appointment is better for me.
zh: 预约在上午对我来说更好。

en: An afternoon appointment is more convenient for me.
zh: 预约在下午对我来说更方便。

en: That's it for your medical exam.
zh: 你的检查做完了。

en: I'd like to make an appointment to see the doctor.
zh: 我想预约看医生。

en: Keep the dog still while I examine him.
zh: 我检查的时候，把狗按住别动。

en: I'll give you a check-up.
zh: 我给你做个检查。

en: I'd like to see the doctor.
zh: 我想看医生。

en: His relatives began to keep away from him.
zh: 他的亲戚们开始疏远他了。

en: Make a few good friends and stick to them.
zh: 交几个好朋友，并和他们深交。

en: Making friends with people doesn't have anything to do with how long you know them.
zh: 交朋友跟认识时间长短没关系。

en: I can talk about anything with my best friend.
zh: 我跟我最好的朋友什么都能聊。

en: Even good friends should make an effort to keep up their friendship.
zh: 就算是好朋友也要用心维持友谊。

en: Father looked me full in the face.
zh: 我爸直盯着我的脸看。

en: My wisdom teeth are coming in.
zh: 我在长智齿。

en: I'm getting my wisdom tooth.
zh: 我长智齿了。

en: One of my wisdom teeth is coming in.
zh: 我有一颗智齿要冒出来了。

en: His relatives were convinced of his innocence.
zh: 他的亲戚都深信他是无辜的。

en: Kindness is the essence of politeness.
zh: 善良是礼貌的本质。

en: I'll always remember your kindness.
zh: 我会永远记住你的好。

en: Kindness is a virtue.
zh: 善良是一种美德。

en: He did me a kindness when he got me a job.
zh: 他帮我找了份工作，真是帮了我个大忙。

en: I am much obliged to you for your kind help.
zh: 太感谢你的热心帮助了。

en: Some people were kind and others were unkind.
zh: 有的人挺友善，有的人则不然。

en: We appreciate your kind advice.
zh: 我们很感激你的建议。

en: Being kind, he is loved by everyone.
zh: 他人很友善，大家都喜欢他。

en: I appreciate your kind letter.
zh: 很感谢你的来信。

en: Thank you for your kind letter.
zh: 谢谢你的来信。

en: Thank you for your kind hospitality.
zh: 谢谢你的盛情款待。

en: I had my thumbnail torn off.
zh: 我大拇指的指甲盖儿被掀掉了。

en: My thumbnail ripped off.
zh: 我大拇指的指甲裂开了。

en: The father and son met after a long separation.
zh: 父子俩分别了很久终于见面了。

en: Trade knows neither friends or kindred.
zh: 商场上不讲私情。

en: It must be nice having such a loyal son. You don't have to wonder if you'll be taken care of in your old age.
zh: 有个这么孝顺的儿子真好，老了就不用愁没人照顾了。

en: By the time you wish to be a good son, your parents are long gone.
zh: 等你想尽孝时，父母可能已经不在了。

en: You should not depend on your parents.
zh: 你不该老指望父母。

en: Find things out for yourself instead of having a parent or a teacher tell you.
zh: 自己去弄明白，别总等着父母或老师告诉你。

en: The mother sponged her sick child's face.
zh: 母亲用毛巾给生病的孩子擦了擦脸。

en: Parents have responsibilities to look to their children's health.
zh: 父母有责任照顾好孩子的健康。

en: Parents should deal fairly with their children.
zh: 父母应该公平地对待孩子。

en: Parents must answer for their children's conduct.
zh: 父母必须对孩子的行为负责。

en: Parents must look after the well-being of the their children.
zh: 父母必须关心孩子的福祉。

en: Parents try not to think about it, hoping that if they blot the children out, the fateful call or cable will never come.
zh: 父母尽量不去想，希望只要不提孩子，那通可怕的电话或电报就永远不会来。

en: Parents must provide their children with proper food and clothing.
zh: 父母必须给孩子提供足够的衣食。

en: Are parents rational about their children?
zh: 父母对待孩子的事能保持理性吗？

en: Parents have various influences on their children.
zh: 父母对孩子有各种各样的影响。

en: Parents provide protection for their children.
zh: 父母会保护自己的孩子。

en: Parents punish their children for misbehavior.
zh: 父母会因为孩子表现不好而惩罚他们。

en: Parents hope their children will become independent as soon as possible.
zh: 父母希望孩子能尽早独立。

en: Parents love their children.
zh: 父母都爱自己的孩子。

en: Parents often make sacrifices to give a good education to their children.
zh: 为了让孩子受好教育，父母经常做出牺牲。

en: Parents are proud of their children when they do well in school.
zh: 孩子在学校表现好，父母会感到很自豪。

en: Nature is a good mother.
zh: 大自然是位伟大的母亲。

en: There is no satisfactory answer a parent can give to this.
zh: 对此，父母也没法给出一个满意的解释。

en: Parents are always worried about the future of their children.
zh: 父母总是担心孩子的未来。

en: My parents wouldn't allow me to go by myself.
zh: 我爸妈不让我一个人去。

en: Our child seems to be brilliant. Of course, we may be prejudiced.
zh: 我们的孩子看起来很聪明，当然，这也许是我们的偏见。

en: The crow thinks her own birds fairest.
zh: 乌鸦也觉得自己家的孩子最漂亮。

en: Children whose parents are dead are referred to as "orphans".
zh: 父母双亡的孩子被称为“孤儿”。

en: Many parents are worried their children are not being given a basic understanding of numbers.
zh: 很多父母担心孩子没能掌握基础的数学概念。

en: It is a wise father that knows his own child.
zh: 知子莫若父。

en: I cannot be too grateful for my parents' kindness.
zh: 父母的恩情我怎么报答都不为过。

en: In the parent's mind, a child grows but does not age.
zh: 在父母眼里，孩子长再大也永远是孩子。

en: I can almost see my parent's happy face in my mind's eye.
zh: 我仿佛能看到父母开心的样子。

en: The son is known by his father.
zh: 了解儿子的人莫过于他的父亲。

en: The sins of the fathers are visited upon the children.
zh: 父辈的罪孽会报应在孩子身上。

en: You should be respectful to your parents.
zh: 你应该孝敬父母。

en: You must show respect towards your parents.
zh: 你一定要尊重你的父母。

en: Happy is she who marries the son of a dead mother.
zh: 嫁给没婆婆的人才叫幸福呢。

en: Have you ever argued with your parents?
zh: 你跟父母吵过架吗？

en: Parents love their children however naughty they are.
zh: 不管孩子多淘气，当爸妈的都疼。

en: His parents should be firm with him.
zh: 他父母应该对他严厉点儿。

en: Parents can pass many diseases on to their offspring.

zh: 我听到树林里有狗叫声。

en: We didn't see many deer in the forest.
zh: 我们在森林里没见到多少鹿。

en: In the woods they found themselves in danger.
zh: 他们在林子里遇到了危险。

en: The silence in the forest is restful.
zh: 森林里的宁静让人很放松。

en: The forest fire began to spread in all directions.
zh: 森林火灾开始向四周蔓延。

en: There stands a cottage close to the forest.
zh: 森林边上有一间小屋。

en: The other animals of the forest came to watch the wedding dance, and they, too, danced all night in the moonlight.
zh: 森林里的其他动物都来观看婚礼舞蹈，它们也都在月光下跳了一整夜。

en: We saw an old hut standing at the margin of the forest.
zh: 我们看到森林边上有一座破旧的小屋。

en: All was still in the woods.
zh: 树林里一片寂静。

en: A beautiful lake lay just beyond the forest.
zh: 森林尽头有一片美丽的湖泊。

en: Before you go hiking in the woods, find out what you should do when you meet a bear.
zh: 去林子里徒步之前，先查查遇到熊该怎么办。

en: I caught sight of a flock of sheep in the forest.
zh: 我在林子里瞥见了一群羊。

en: Birds were singing in the woods.
zh: 鸟儿在树林里鸣叫。

en: It's a pity that Mr. Mori can't come to see us.
zh: 真可惜，森先生不能来看我们了。

en: I built a house within a stone's throw of the forest.
zh: 我在离林子非常近的地方盖了座房子。

en: The newcomer carried off the first prize.
zh: 那个新来的拿了第一名。

en: The new medicine saved me from an illness.
zh: 这新药治好了我的病。

en: The new medicine saved his life.
zh: 这新药救了他的命。

en: The new trade accord will pump fresh blood into the international economy.
zh: 新的贸易协议将为国际经济注入新鲜血液。

en: Act your place.
zh: 守好你的本分。

en: According to newspaper reports, there was an airplane accident last evening.
zh: 据报纸报道，昨天晚上发生了一起空难。

en: The newspaper boy delivers papers in any kind of weather.
zh: 那个送报员不管天气如何都会去送报。

en: The newspaper boy delivers newspapers no matter what the weather is like.
zh: 不管天气好坏，送报员都会准时送报纸。

en: The press are arriving in force.
zh: 大批记者正成群结队地赶来。

en: I'd like to talk to you away from the press.
zh: 我想避开媒体单独跟你谈谈。

en: I have come in response to your ad in the paper.
zh: 我是看到报纸上的广告才过来的。

en: According to the newspaperman, it makes life worthwhile, doesn't it?
zh: 按照那个记者的说法，这让生活变得有意义了，不是吗？

en: The newspaperman should get his facts straight.
zh: 那个记者应该先把事实搞清楚。

en: You're a reporter.
zh: 你是个记者。

en: Read the newspaper every day, or you will get behind the times.
zh: 每天读读报，不然你就跟不上时代了。

en: How can you make a living from selling newspapers?
zh: 靠卖报纸怎么养家糊口啊？

en: The man reading a newspaper is his father.
zh: 那个正在看报纸的人是他父亲。

en: Having read the newspaper, I know about the accident.
zh: 看了报纸，我才知道发生了那起事故。

en: He makes it a rule to wear glasses when he reads a newspaper.
zh: 他看报纸的时候习惯戴眼镜。

en: Can I have the paper when you're finished with it?
zh: 你看完报纸能给我看下吗？

en: Please, you can have the paper first.
zh: 没事，你先看报纸吧。

en: Get me the newspaper.
zh: 帮我把报纸拿过来。

en: Bring me the newspaper, please.
zh: 请把报纸递给我。

en: Bring me the newspaper.
zh: 把报纸给我拿来。

en: Will you put down that paper and listen to me?
zh: 你能不能放下报纸听我说话？

en: I have a newspaper clipping file.
zh: 我有一个剪报集。

en: Pitch the newspaper onto the porch.
zh: 把报纸扔到门廊上。

en: Help me bind the papers into bundles.
zh: 帮我把报纸扎成捆。

en: May I have the paper after you, please?
zh: 等你用完报纸，能借我看看吗？

en: Newspapers distribute information to the public.
zh: 报纸向大众传播信息。

en: The newspaper told of the mother's anguish at the death of her son.
zh: 报纸报道了那位母亲在失去儿子后的痛苦。

en: The newspaper reflects public opinion.
zh: 报纸反映了公众舆论。

en: The newspaper always keeps us informed of the events taking place in the world.
zh: 报纸能让我们随时了解世界上发生的大事。

en: Newspapers influence the current of time.
zh: 报纸影响着时代的潮流。

en: A newspaper tells us what is happening in the world.
zh: 报纸告诉我们世界上正在发生什么。

en: The newspaper is of great value in the world today.
zh: 报纸在当今世界仍有很大的价值。

en: Are you through with the paper?
zh: 报纸你看完了吗？

en: Are you done with the paper?
zh: 你看完报纸了吗？

en: Are you finished with the paper?
zh: 这报纸你看完了没？

en: The newspapers opened fire on the politician.
zh: 各大报纸开始猛烈抨击那个政客。

en: The newspaper said another war broke out in Africa.
zh: 报上说非洲又爆发了一场战争。

en: The newspaper supplies news.
zh: 报纸提供新闻资讯。

en: The newspaper reported the death of the statesman.
zh: 报纸报道了那位政治家的死讯。

en: The newspapers gave a lot of space to the affair.
zh: 报纸对那件事进行了大篇幅报道。

en: The newspaper declared for the Republican candidate.
zh: 报纸表态支持共和党候选人。

en: The newspaper extracted several passages from the speech.
zh: 报纸摘录了演讲中的几段话。

en: Newspapers did not report the news.
zh: 报纸没报这条新闻。

en: Newspapers did not report that news.
zh: 报纸没报那条新闻。

en: Have you got through with the paper?
zh: 报纸你看完了吗？

en: How many papers do you take?
zh: 你订了几份报纸？

en: The newspaper is by your side.
zh: 报纸就在你旁边。

en: The newspaper reported friction between the two parties.
zh: 报纸报道了两党之间的摩擦。

en: The function of the press is to provide the common people with facts.
zh: 媒体的作用就是给老百姓提供事实。

en: It is from advertising that a newspaper earns most of its profits.
zh: 报纸的大部分利润都来自广告。

en: Reject all its lies and vulgarity.
zh: 拒绝它所有的谎言和低俗内容。

en: Don't go by what the newspapers say.
zh: 别全信报上说的。

en: What is reported in the paper is an obvious fact.
zh: 报上报的是明摆着的事实。

en: A criticism of literary works this year is in the paper.
zh: 报纸上有篇关于今年文学作品的评论。

en: According to the paper, there was an earthquake in Mexico.
zh: 报上说墨西哥地震了。

en: According to the paper, it will snow tomorrow.
zh: 报上说明天要下雪。

en: I think I will advertise in the paper.
zh: 我想在报纸上打个广告。

en: According to the paper, there was an earthquake in Peru.
zh: 报上说秘鲁发生地震了。

en: According to the newspapers, he will be here today.
zh: 报纸上说他今天会到。

en: According to the newspaper, he participated in the plot.
zh: 报纸上说他参与了那个阴谋。

en: According to the newspaper, the cost of living in Tokyo is the highest in the world.
zh: 报上说东京的生活费是全球最高的。

en: According to the newspaper, the boy was knocked unconscious and lay on his back with his eyes closed.
zh: 报上说那个男孩被撞晕了，闭着眼仰面躺着。

en: The newspaper reports the prime minister has died of cancer.
zh: 报上说首相死于癌症。

en: According to the paper, there was an earthquake last night.
zh: 报上说昨晚地震了。

en: According to the papers, there was a big fire in the town.
zh: 报上说镇上起大火了。

en: The papers say that there was a big fire in Nagoya.
zh: 报纸上说名古屋发生了大火。

en: According to the newspaper, he will be here today.
zh: 报上说他今天会来。

en: The newspaper says that he committed suicide.
zh: 报纸上说他自杀了。

en: According to the newspaper, he committed suicide.
zh: 报上说他自杀了。

en: According to the papers, the man has finally confessed.
zh: 报上说那个人终于招了。

en: The newspaper said that a typhoon was approaching.
zh: 报纸上说台风正逼近。

en: The paper says that a typhoon is on its way.
zh: 报上说台风快到了。

en: According to the newspaper, there was a big fire last night.
zh: 报纸上说昨晚起了一场大火。

en: The newspaper said that XYZ oil company went belly-up today.
zh: 报纸上说XYZ石油公司今天倒闭了。

en: According to the paper, there was a big fire in Boston.
zh: 报上说波士顿发生了大火。

en: Newspapers carry weather reports.
zh: 报纸上都有天气预报。

en: There's nothing important in the paper.
zh: 报纸上没什么重要的事。

en: There is nothing interesting in the newspaper.
zh: 报纸上没什么有意思的内容。

en: There was nothing interesting in the newspaper.
zh: 报上没什么好玩的。

en: Not a day seems to pass without newspapers reporting the war.
zh: 报纸好像每天都在报道战争。

en: Where's the newspaper?
zh: 报纸在哪儿？

en: Where is the newspaper?
zh: 报纸在哪儿呢？

en: I saw in the paper that he had returned from the South Pole.
zh: 我在报上看到他从南极回来了。

en: What the newspaper said about the weather has certainly come true.
zh: 报纸上说的天气还真准。

en: What the newspaper said about the weather will certainly come true.
zh: 报纸上说的天气肯定会准。

en: What the newspapers say is true.
zh: 报纸上说的都是真的。

en: I clipped some articles out of the newspaper.
zh: 我从报纸上剪下了几篇文章。

en: Let me read the newspaper if you've finished with it.
zh: 你看完了的话，报纸给我看下。

en: Two whole pages of the newspaper were devoted to the news of the royal divorce.
zh: 报纸用了整整两个版面来报道王室离婚的消息。

en: Newspapers, television, and radio are called the mass media.
zh: 报纸、电视和广播被称为大众媒体。

en: The new discovery proved useful to science.
zh: 这项新发现证明对科学很有用。

en: We had a very good time at a New Year's party.
zh: 我们在新年派对上玩得很开心。
